contentrichtext.text: <noinclude>{{../doc}} {{divhide|Staging area}} ==Images== Use only ONE image at a time <gallery> Image:Abraham Ortelius.jpg|Abraham Ortelius Image:OrteliusWorldMap.jpeg|Abraham Ortelius' world map File:Levi Strauss.jpg|Levi Strauss </gallery> ==Ineligible== {|class="wikitable" |- !Blurb !Reason |- |[[1293]] – [[Sancho IV of Castile and León|Sancho IV]], King of [[List of Monarchs of Castile|Castile]] and [[List of Monarchs of Leon|León]], established what is now the '''[[Complutense University of Madrid]]''', today one of Spain's top public universities. |unreferenced section |- |[[1498]] – Portuguese explorer '''[[Vasco da Gama]]''' arrived at [[Kozhikode|Calicut]], India, opening up trade with the Far East directly by sea. |appears on [[Wikipedia:Selected anniversaries/February 12|February 12]] |- |[[1570]] – The first modern [[atlas]], ''Theatrum Orbis Terrarum''<!-- ''(world map pictured)''--> by [[Cartography|cartographer]] '''[[Abraham Ortelius]]''', was issued. |refimprove |- |[[1882]] – The '''[[Triple Alliance (1882)|Triple Alliance]]''' was created between Germany, [[Austria-Hungary]] and Italy. |unreferenced section, date not verified |- |[[1902]] – Cuba officially gained independence from the United States, with '''[[Tomás Estrada Palma]]''' becoming its first [[President of Cuba|president]]. |needs more footnotes |- |[[1969]] – [[Vietnam War]]: After ten days of battle, [[United States Army|U.S. infantry]] troops captured the strategically insignificant '''[[Battle of Hamburger Hill|Hill 937]]''', only to abandon it two weeks later. |needs more footnotes |- |[[1996]] – The [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] '''[[Romer v. Evans|struck down]]''' laws in [[Colorado]] that would have prevented any city, town or county in the state from taking any legislative, executive, or judicial action to protect [[homosexual]] citizens from discrimination on the basis of their sexual orientation. |refimprove |} ==Eligible== {{*mp}} [[1217]] – In the '''[[Battle of Lincoln (1217)|Battle of Lincoln]]''', the last land battle of the [[First Barons' War]], [[William Marshal, 1st Earl of Pembroke|William the Marshal]] drove [[Louis VIII of France|Prince Louis of France]] out of England. {{*mp}} [[1609]] – [[Thomas Thorpe]] published the first copies of '''[[Shakespeare's sonnets]]''', possibly without [[William Shakespeare]]'s consent. {{*mp}} [[1862]] – U.S. President [[Abraham Lincoln]] signed the first '''[[Homestead Acts|Homestead Act]]''' into law, which gave the right to claim [[Fee simple|freehold]] title to about {{convert|160|acre|sqkm|2}} of undeveloped land in the American West. {{*mp}} [[1873]] – Clothing manufacturer '''[[Levi Strauss]]''' and tailor [[Jacob Davis (inventor)|Jacob Davis]] were granted a [[patent]] for using copper rivets to strengthen the pockets of [[denim]] overalls, allowing [[Levi Strauss & Co.|their company]] to start manufacturing their first line of [[Jeans|blue jeans]]. {{*mp}} [[2002]] – '''[[East Timor]]''' gained independence from [[Indonesia]], becoming the first new [[List of sovereign states|sovereign state]] of the 21st century. {{divhide|end}} </noinclude> '''[[May 20]]''': '''[[Day of Remembrance (Cambodia)|Day of Remembrance]]''' in Cambodia; [[National Day]] in '''[[Cameroon]]''' ([[1972]]); '''[[Victoria Day]]''' in Canada (2013); [[List of national independence days|Independence Day]] in '''[[East Timor]]''' ([[2002]]); '''[[Budi Utomo|National Awakening Day]]''' in Indonesia ([[1908]]) <div style="float:right;margin-left:0.5em"> [[Image:IbnSaud.jpg|Ibn Saud|100x100px]] </div> {{*mp}} [[325]] – The '''[[First Council of Nicaea]]''', the first [[ecumenical council]] of the [[Christianity|Christian Church]], was formally opened in present-day [[Iznik]], Turkey<!-- to resolve disagreements in the [[List of Patriarchs of Alexandria|Church of Alexandria]] over the nature of [[Jesus]] in relationship to [[God the Father]]-->. {{*mp}} [[685]] – The [[Picts]] '''[[Battle of Dun Nechtain|defeated]]''' the [[Northumbria]]ns near [[Dunnichen]], severely weakening the latter's power in northern Great Britain. {{*mp}} [[1875]] – Representatives from seventeen countries signed the '''[[Metre Convention]]''' which set up an institute for the purpose of coordinating international [[metrology]] and for coordinating the development of the [[metric system]]. {{*mp}} [[1927]] – By the [[Treaty of Jeddah]]<!--Not bolded, stubby-->, the United Kingdom recognized the sovereignty of King '''[[Ibn Saud]]''' ''(pictured)'' over [[Hejaz]] and [[Nejd]], which later merged to become Saudi Arabia. {{*mp}} [[1983]] – A team of researchers led by French [[virology|virologist]] '''[[Luc Montagnier]]''' published their discovery of [[HIV]], although they did not know yet if it caused [[AIDS]]. </ul> {{SelAnnivFooter|Month=May|Day=20}}<noinclude> </noinclude>
